The minimum requirements for opening a makgeolli brewery in British Columbia would depend on a variety of factors, including the size and scope of the operation, as well as the specific regulations and requirements set out by the Liquor and Cannabis Regulation Branch (LCRB). However, some of the general requirements that you would need to meet include:

1. Licenses and Permits: You will need to obtain various licenses and permits from the LCRB, as well as other agencies such as the health department and local government. This can include a manufacturer's license, liquor primary license, food premises permit, and other authorizations as needed.
2. Space: You will need to secure a suitable space for your brewery, with enough room to store equipment, raw materials, and finished product. The space must also meet all relevant health and safety requirements.
3. Equipment: You will need to purchase or lease the necessary equipment for brewing, storing, and packaging your makgeolli, as well as any equipment needed for your tasting room or other on-site sales.
4. Raw Materials: You will need to source high-quality rice, nuruk, and other ingredients needed for making makgeolli.
5. Staff: You will need to hire staff to help with brewing, packaging, and running the tasting room or other on-site sales.
6. Branding and Marketing: You will need to develop a brand identity and marketing materials to promote your brewery and your products.

Meeting these minimum requirements can be a complex process, and you will need to consult with relevant regulatory agencies and other experts to ensure that you meet all the necessary standards and requirements.
